results.title: The Thread makers
results.creator_credit: James Archibald, John Chittock and James Archibald and Associates
results.brief_description: Illustrates the nature of J. & B. Coats’ activities as makers and marketeers of thread of all types for every variety of use. Filmed in India, Austria, Spain, England and Scotland with a strong emphasis on the human interest. The development of synthetic thread, requiring new techniques and processes, is shown to be a likely prospect for the future

results.title: The Thirteenth floor
results.brief_description: This film takes a humorous look at all the safety errors committed in a short time in a typical office. It is effective in pointing out the hazards which exist in offices and the accidents which workers can cause - or control.

results.title: Video maker
results.creator_credit: Shane Yeend, Scott Young, Alliance Productions and Nine Network (Australia)
results.brief_description: Video maker is designed to help transform the confused home video operator into a budding video director. This tape looks at topics such as focus, handheld and zoom, camera editing, depth of field and exposure as well as looking at terminology, different filming techniques and equipment.

results.title: Senso daughters
results.creator_credit: Noriko Sekiguchi, Institute of Papua New Guinea Studies, Siglo Co and Tenchijin Productions
results.brief_description: Senso means “War”. “Senso daughters” is an account of the experience of Papua New Guinean and Japanese women in the South Pacific during World War II. A unique film in that it critically looks at the effect of the war not only on the indigenous culture but also on the Japanese people. Anti-war sentiment has never been tolerated within Japanese culture. For director, Noriko Sekiguchi, the film is very much a personal statement with a global message. Not only does the film critically question the war-time decisions of the late Emperor Hirohito, but it also makes public for the first time some startling information. The Japanese army took “comfort women” when they were occupying a new territory. The army prostitutes were conscripted from Korean and poor Japanese women and shipped to military bases in Rabaul.

results.title: Wind
results.creator_credit: Ivan Sen, Graeme Isaac, ABS, Australian Film Commission, New South Wales Film and Television Office and SBS Independent
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Crossing Tracks Series”.
1857, The Australian Alps. Jess, a young black tracker and his elderly sergeant discover the body of a gold miner. They track the killer, an old Aboriginal man, to a cabin on a clear plateau. After losing their horse and with the sergeant in bad health they are forced to shelter in a cabin. As Jess falls asleep he is visited in his dreams by the old Aboriginal man. When Jess is faced with executing the old man he is forced to decide his fate, to choose his friend the sergeant, or to follow his ancestral soul. Cast includes Ralph Cotterill, Bradley Byqar and Steve Dodd.

results.title: Saturday night: Sunday morning [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Rima Tamou, Pauline Clague, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, Australian Film Commission and New South Wales Film and Television Office
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Crossing Tracks Series”.
Based on the Archie Weller short story, this film takes us on a journey into the discontented life of Melanie as she grapples with adolescence, rural isolation and life with her dysfunctional father. Her difficulties escalate when she is taken hostage by three young men for whom life has very little meaning and actions have no consequences. Essentially a rites of passage drama, both Melanie and her captors struggle to come to terms with assumptions of difference, indigenous and non-indigenous race relations, institutionalised injustice, and loss. Cast includes Alyssa McClelland, Peter Browne and Luke Caroll.

results.title: Harry's War
results.creator_credit: Richard Frankland, John Foss, Jill Bilcock, ABC-TV (Australia), AFI [au], Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, Film Victoria and Golden Seahorse Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Crossing Tracks Series”.
Harry, a Koorie, and Mitch, a non-Aboriginal Australian, are two mates who go off to fight in Papua New Guinea during the Second World War. Harry grows from a boy in uniform to a man in war. We watch as he learns of his impending death and how he faces it. ‘Harry’s War’ is about when mateship transcends race, cultural differences and social barriers. It is a story of how war drives men to the brink and the journey becomes more important than the journey’s end. Cast includes: David Ngoombujarra, Peter Docker, Glenn Shea, Bob Maza and Christina Saunders.

results.title: Windhorse
results.creator_credit: Paul Wagner, Thupten Tsering, Julia Elliott and Paul Wagner Productions
results.brief_description: Director Paul Wagner along with his cast and crew posed as tourists with video cameras to shoot this film on location in Tibet, avoiding Chinese secret police and security cameras in the process. The film follows a number of story lines that depict the plight of Tibetans at the hand of Chinese aggressors. Cast includes Dadon, Jampa Kelsang, Richard Chang, Lu Yu and Taije Silverman. Many cast and crew have asked that their names be withheld to protect themselves and their families. In Tibetan and Chinese with English subtitles.
